channel.title: A Thought
channel.description:
I just had a thought in relation to random events, although, I'm not completely sure if it's true, as we don't know shit about serverside on real RuneScape, but...
[b]All the random values sent to the server, those extra bytes and what not, could they relate to the randomization of random events?[/b]
For example: Client sends, lets say, a random value between 1 and 10. Server parses it and determines if its a random event or not. Server sends random event.

item.title: A Thought
item.dc:creator: @cartridges cartridges
item.description:
@cartridges wrote:

It’s purely speculation. However, looking at the old deobs of the client back in the time and predating that of scarscape… You’ll notice they didn’t have such routines… So based on evidence provided and the fact these “random bytes” were added at the pinnacle of Scarscape, one can infer, that they are simply as BAsh says.

Read full topic

item.title: A Thought
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Also some of them establish the client half of the session key.

Read full topic

item.title: A Thought
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

I would say the random bytes sent to the server determine if you are using a Math.random() hack or not.

Read full topic

item.title: A Thought
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

No. The server decides when to send a random event based on the info the client must send for it to be functional.
Not that I’m an all knowing genius about the client (semaphore), but it’s the only logical way of doing it.

Read full topic
